title: James Comey, Former FBI Director, Indicted After Pressure From Trump
summary: The move came after the president intensified his pressure campaign on the Justice Department in recent days, publicly demanding that top officials prosecute Mr. Comey.

title: With Comey Indictment, Trump Gets Retribution but Shatters Norms
summary: A prosecutor’s drive to indict James Comey trampled over the Justice Department’s long tradition of keeping a distance from politics and the White House, and raised the prospect of more arbitrary charges.

title: Trump Will Slap Tariffs on Imported Drugs, Trucks and Household Furnishings
summary: The president said his tariffs would range from 25 to 100 percent and go into effect next week.

title: Hegseth Is Said to Have Summoned U.S. Military Brass From Around the Globe
summary: The unusual directive, without a stated reason, came after the defense secretary fired several top officers and ordered a reduction in four-star officers.

title: Trump Orders Broad Effort to Root Out Groups He Says Organize Political Violence
summary: President Trump has long maintained that liberal activists and organizations secretly fund political violence. Law enforcement officials say efforts like the antifascist movement are often disparate groups.

title: Trump Clears Way for American-Owned TikTok Valued at $14 Billion
summary: The administration has been working for months to find non-Chinese investors for a U.S. version of the app.

title: Amazon to Pay $2.5 Billion in Prime Membership Settlement
summary: The settlement is one of the largest in the history of the Federal Trade Commission, which sued Amazon two years ago.

title: Trump Wades Into Bailout Politics in Offering a Lifeline to Argentina
summary: A $20 billion loan to support Argentina’s president, Javier Milei, could come with economic and political risks.

title: Trump Says He Won’t Allow Israel to Annex the West Bank
summary: After more countries recognized a Palestinian state this week, President Trump said on Thursday that he would not permit Israel to take over the territory.

title: Kennedy Says U.S. Rejects Global Health Goals
summary: The nation’s top federal health official said the United States could not support W.H.O. policies that he claimed promoted abortion and “radical gender ideology.”

title: Countries Consider A.I.’s Dangers and Benefits at U.N.
summary: The United Nations announced a new “global dialogue on artificial intelligence governance,” and a new global A.I. panel on the technology’s risks and rewards.

title: ‘One Battle After Another’ Review: Paul Thomas Anderson’s Rallying Cry
summary: The director, at the height of his powers, delivers a startling, present-day American epic, with Leonardo DiCaprio as a washed-up radical and doting dad.

title: The Battle to Make ‘One Battle After Another’
summary: Leonardo DiCaprio, Sean Penn, Regina Hall and the rest of the cast talk about filming a politically charged movie in a fraught year.

title: As Trump’s H-1B Visa Fee Targets Foreign Workers, China Woos Them
summary: A new visa for science and engineering graduates is part of China’s effort to establish itself as the world leader in science and technology.

title: What’s Behind Nexstar and Sinclair Boycotting Jimmy Kimmel?
summary: Nexstar and Sinclair say their boycott of the late-night host is all about what he said. But both are exploring deals for their sprawling networks of local TV stations.

title: Attack on Dallas ICE Was ‘Very Definition of Terrorism,’ Prosecutor Says
summary: Federal officials said the gunman intended to shoot immigration agents, calling it a “tragic irony” that three detainees were struck, one fatally.

title: U.S. Agent Pushes Woman to Floor in Immigration Courthouse Confrontation
summary: In a scene caught on video, the woman and a young girl were clinging to a man who was being detained. Agents pulled their hair, then one shoved the woman after she touched his chest.

title: L.A. Wildfire Evacuations Were Slowed by System Weaknesses, New Report Finds
summary: An independent report on the January disaster found that emergency alerts were hampered by flawed policies, aging equipment and high winds.

title: China Is Promising a Lot More Clean Energy While America Is Lost
summary: While the West is distracted and divided, China is focused and surging ahead.

title: The Grand Strategy Behind Trump’s Crackdown on Academia
summary: Ending the “culture of victimhood” on campus.

title: Canada Orders Postal Service to End Door-to-Door Mail Delivery
summary: The government’s previous attempts at postal service cuts were politically unpopular, but Canada Post’s dire financial situation has expedited them.

title: As Right-Wing Populism Rises, Progressives Meet to Share Tactics in London
summary: Center-left figures including Mark Carney, Keir Starmer, Pete Buttigieg and Jacinda Ardern are set to attend a summit on Friday as their brand of politics appears under threat.

title: Maxine Clair, Writer Who Came to Her Craft in Middle Age, Dies at 86
summary: She published her first book of poems at 49 and her first work of prose, the acclaimed novel “Rattlebone,” six years later.

title: 13-Year-Old Shot in the Head While Walking to School Dies Days Later
summary: Sanjay Samuel, who had recently started ninth grade, was shot in Queens in what authorities said was gang-related violence. The police are seeking a 16-year-old suspect.
